settings.title: Step 1
settings.description: Start in a plank position with your hands gripping dumbbells on the floor, keeping your body in a straight line.
settings.note: Pull one dumbbell up toward your chest in a rowing motion, engaging your back and keeping your hips level.
settings.caution: Fight the urge to rotate your hips as you row; a wide foot stance will help maintain stability and core engagement.

settings.title: Renegade Rows
settings.subtitle: A challenging compound exercise that combines core stability with back strength. Perfect for building functional strength, improving balance, and developing a strong core and back simultaneously.
settings.about_description: Renegade Rows are a dynamic full-body exercise that combines a plank position with rowing movements. This exercise targets the latissimus dorsi, rhomboids, and middle trapezius while simultaneously engaging the entire core, including the rectus abdominis, obliques, and deep stabilizers. The unilateral nature of the movement challenges balance and coordination, making it an excellent exercise for developing functional strength and improving overall body control.
